title: How has problem-solving changed with technology?

korean: 기술 발전으로 문제 해결 방식이 정말 많이 바뀐 것 같아요.
예전에는 문제가 생기면 책을 찾아보거나 사람들한테 물어봐야 했는데요,
지금은 스마트폰으로 바로 검색하면 답을 찾을 수 있어요.
구글이나 네이버에 검색하면 거의 모든 정보가 나오거든요.
유튜브에는 거의 모든 종류의 튜토리얼이 있어서 도움이 많이 돼요.
기계가 고장 나도 유튜브 보고 직접 고치는 사람들도 많고요.
또 챗GPT 같은 AI가 나오면서 더 편해졌어요.
복잡한 질문도 하면 바로 답변을 줘서 시간이 많이 절약돼요.
온라인 커뮤니티도 활발해서 경험담을 쉽게 공유받을 수 있고요.
네이버 지식인이나 레딧 같은 데서 비슷한 문제를 겪은 사람들 답변을 보면 도움이 돼요.
근데 정보가 너무 많아서 뭐가 맞는지 판단하기 어려울 때도 있어요.
그래도 전반적으로 문제 해결이 훨씬 빠르고 쉬워진 건 확실해요.
신뢰할 수 있는 출처를 찾는 법을 배워야 하는데, 이게 좀 어려울 수 있어요.
그래도 대부분의 문제 해결책이 클릭 몇 번이면 나오는 놀라운 시대에 살고 있어요.
english: So I honestly think that problem-solving methods have really changed dramatically with all the technological development we've seen.
Like, before the internet age, when problems arose in daily life, you basically had to look through thick books or ask knowledgeable people for help.
But now, you can literally find answers to almost anything by immediately searching on your smartphone within seconds.
If you just type your question into Google or Naver, almost all the information you need comes up right away.
YouTube has become especially helpful because it has detailed tutorial videos for almost every kind of problem you can imagine.
Even when household machines or appliances break down, many people now just watch YouTube repair videos and fix them directly themselves.
Also, it's become incredibly more convenient recently with AI assistants like ChatGPT coming out.
You can ask even really complex questions, and it gives you detailed answers right away, which saves so much time and effort.
Online communities are also super active nowadays, so you can easily get advice and shared experiences from other people.
It's really helpful to read answers from people who have experienced similar problems on platforms like Naver Knowledge iN or Reddit.
But honestly, sometimes there's actually too much information available online, so it becomes hard to judge what's actually correct or reliable.
You have to learn to filter through all the noise and find trustworthy sources, which can be challenging.
Still, despite this challenge, it's absolutely certain that overall problem-solving has become so much faster and easier than before.
We're honestly living in an amazing era where solutions to most problems are literally just a few clicks away, you know?
